qas.question: What treaty ceded territory to the US extending west to the Mississippi River?
What three major tribes occupied these formerly British territories?
When was the Battle of Wabash fought?
What was the decisive battle in the Northwest territories against the native population there?
When was this deciding battle fought?
What treaty ceded territory to the UK extending west to the Mississippi River?
What three major tribes occupied these formerly French territories?
When was the Battle of Washburn fought?
What was the decisive battle in the Southeast territories against the native population there?
When was this deciding battle postponed?

context: In the <a0_0><b5_0>Treaty of Paris<b5_0/><a0_0/> after the Revolution, the British had ceded the lands between the Appalachian Mountains and the Mississippi River to the United States, without consulting the <a1_0><b6_0>Shawnee, Cherokee, Choctaw<b6_0/><a1_0/> and other smaller tribes who lived there. Because many of the tribes had fought as allies of the British, the United States compelled tribal leaders to sign away lands in postwar treaties, and began dividing these lands for settlement. This provoked a war in the Northwest Territory in which the U.S. forces performed poorly; the Battle of the Wabash in <a2_0><b7_0>1791<b7_0/><a2_0/> was the most severe defeat ever suffered by the United States at the hands of American Indians. President Washington dispatched a newly trained army to the region, which decisively defeated the Indian confederacy at <a3_0>the <b8_0>Battle of Fallen Timbers<b8_0/><a3_0/> in <a4_0><b9_0>1794<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
